parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The erratic throttle response can cause sudden and unexpected rapid deceleration and acceleration, leading to loss of control and potentially causing accidents, especially during cornering.

The failure of the regulator rectifier can cause the motorcycle to suddenly lose power, leading to accidents or near-misses, especially when riding at high speeds. This issue can also cause the electrical system to malfunction, leading to a loss of brake lights, blinkers, and other critical safety features.
The electrical system malfunction can cause the throttle to shut off abruptly, leading to a loss of control and increased risk of accidents, especially when riding at high speeds or in turns.
symptoms: rear wheel speed matches engine speed

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden and unexpected rapid deceleration and acceleration can cause loss of control, potentially leading to accidents or crashes.
symptoms: Jerky feeling from de-acceleration to acceleration
sudden and rapid deceleration and acceleration
inability to maintain a steady speed

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The engine stalling or cutting out can cause loss of control, potentially leading to accidents or crashes.
symptoms: Engine cutting out as if the kill switch was tapped
loss of control of the motorcycle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine overheating can cause engine damage, potentially leading to engine failure or breakdown.
symptoms: thermostat stuck in a partly opened position
